cs.IT, cs.SI, cs.LG, cs.NA, cs.DS. 

The paper deals with sampling and interpolation of signals defined on graphs, which is a topic that falls under the intersection of several sub-fields in computer science. However, the main focus of the paper is on the use of graph-shift operators to capture the frequency content of the signals, which is a technique commonly used in information theory (cs.IT) and signal processing (cs.SI). The paper also discusses the structure of the sampling matrix and its relationship with the graph structure, which is a topic in graph theory (cs.LG). Additionally, the paper presents numerical experiments on synthetic and real-world graphs, which suggests that the proposed method could have practical applications in numerical analysis (cs.NA) and data science (cs.DS).
